description:
Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.

Google Express is Google's online marketplace that connects merchant, retailers, and users. The Product Operations team within Google Express partners with Product Management, Engineering, and Operations to design and build next-generation eCommerce tools and systems. In this role, you will design product features and supporting operational processes to drive operational efficiency at global scale, leading complex programs within a highly cross-functional role.

As a Category Lead, you will guide the Everyday Essential Categories (i.e., Food, Beverages, Household Supplies, and Pet Supplies), developing a vision and strategy for growth. You will also work cross-functionally to expand assortment, improve offer competitiveness, and build category-specific shopping experiences that improve purchase conversion. As a leader, you’ll be responsible for the overall assortment and growth of the business.

Google’s Global Partnerships team powers extraordinary user experiences through meaningful partnerships. We build relationships that solve users’ needs, advance our partners’ goals, and further Google’s mission. Our team provides solutions for a range of partners — from helping publishers and developers grow their businesses through monetization solutions, to helping our long-term partners anticipate and navigate change in a way that delivers economic and reputational value. We build and distribute Google products through partnerships across a multitude of product areas, including Search, Assistant, Geo, News, Travel, and more. We collaborate across Google, ensuring a coordinated approach when engaging with our most complex and strategic partners.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 8 years of experience in merchandising or as category manager in the retail industry.
  • 3 years of experience in eCommerce.
  • Experience in eCommerce site experience optimization.

Preferred qualifications:

  • 4 years of experience working in Food, Beverage, Household, and Pet supplies.
  • Experience with Big Box retailers' consumer websites.
  • Marketplace experience.
  • Track record of success and relationships within the industry (e.g., manufactures, distributors, and retailers).
  • Track record of exceeding goals.
responsibilities:
• Define vision and strategy for the essentials (i.e., Food, Beverage, Household, and Pet Supplies) category experiences on Google. Lead strategies to grow in the essentials categories.
  • Work closely with Product, UX, and Engineering to design and drive a multi­-year roadmap, balancing short­ and long­-term goals and investments to scale products globally.
  • Determine critical metrics to monitor and gain insights on the category assortment, pricing, and inventory in order to drive strategy and execution. Define and exceed retention metrics in collaboration with Merchandising, Product, and Marketing teams.
  • Partner closely with Product, Engineering, and Business Development teams to build category specific shopping experiences. Implement feature improvements in categories successfully.
  • Rely on data insights to fosters an effective team environment. Learn the nuances of the business.
title: Category Lead, Essentials, Google Shopping
